meanings.definition: A person or thing that sibilates.
meanings.sent1: The sibilators in the room were making a lot of noise.
meanings.sent2: The snake is a sibilators, hissing softly as it slithers through the grass.
meanings.sent3: The sibilators at the party were so loud, they sounded like a group of hissing snakes.
meanings.sent4: The sibilators in the forest created a symphony of soft, soothing sounds.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the eerie sound of the sibilators in the dark alley.

meanings.definition: A device that produces a hissing sound.
meanings.sent1: The old kettle on the stove was a reliable sibilators.
meanings.sent2: The sibilators on the car's brakes warned pedestrians of its approach.
meanings.sent3: The sibilators in the kitchen always made me jump when they whistled.
meanings.sent4: The sibilators on the train tracks echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The sibilators on the teapot sang a high-pitched tune as the water boiled.

meanings.definition: A group of animals that make sibilant sounds.
meanings.sent1: The sibilators in the zoo captivated the visitors with their hissing chorus.
meanings.sent2: The sibilators in the forest could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The sibilators in the barnyard put on a hissing concert every evening.
meanings.sent4: The sibilators in the swamp created a mysterious atmosphere at night.
meanings.sent5: The sibilators in the aviary filled the air with their melodious hisses.
